snippet: Kerry Washington, in “Scandal” on ABC, is one of the few African-American female leads in a network drama in American television history.
abstract: ABC political thriller Scandal has won high ratings due partly to popularity among African-American audiences; one reason for success is casting of actress Kerry Washington, who became first African-American female lead in network drama in almost 40 years, prompting critical discussion about whether show represents new era of postracial television.
lead_paragraph: Kerry Washington, in “Scandal” on ABC, is one of the few African-American female leads in a network drama in American television history.

headline.main: A Show Makes Friends and History
headline.print_headline: A Show Makes Friends and History
